summary.long: Galatians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul an apostle—sent neither by human commission nor from human authorities but through Jesus Christ and God the Father, who raised him from the dead—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and all the brothers and sisters with me,
To the churches of Galatia:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who gave himself for our sins to set us free from the present evil age, according to the will of our God and Father,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to whom be the glory forever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am astonished that you are so quickly deserting the one who called you in the grace of Christ and are turning to a different gospel—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not that there is another gospel, but there are some who are confusing you and want to pervert the gospel of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even if we or an angel from heaven should proclaim to you a gospel contrary to what we proclaimed to you, let that one be accursed!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As we have said before, so now I repeat, if anyone proclaims to you a gospel contrary to what you received, let that one be accursed!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Am I now seeking human approval or God’s approval? Or am I trying to please people? If I were still pleasing people, I would not be a servant of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I want you to know, brothers and sisters, that the gospel that was proclaimed by me is not of human origin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I did not receive it from a human source, nor was I taught it, but I received it through a revelation of Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have heard, no doubt, of my earlier life in Judaism. I was violently persecuting the church of God and was trying to destroy it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I advanced in Judaism beyond many among my people of the same age, for I was far more zealous for the traditions of my ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the one who had set me apart before I was born and called me through his grace was pleased
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to reveal his Son to me, so that I might proclaim him among the gentiles, I did not confer with any human,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor did I go up to Jerusalem to those who were already apostles before me, but I went away at once into Arabia, and afterward I returned to Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then after three years I did go up to Jerusalem to visit Cephas and stayed with him fifteen days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I did not see any other apostle except James the Lord’s brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In what I am writing to you, before God, I do not lie!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I went into the regions of Syria and Cilicia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I was still unknown by sight to the churches of Judea that are in Christ;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they only heard it said, “The one who formerly was persecuting us is now proclaiming the faith he once tried to destroy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they glorified God because of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then after fourteen years I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, taking Titus along with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I went up in response to a revelation. Then I laid before them (though only in a private meeting with the acknowledged leaders) the gospel that I proclaim among the gentiles, in order to make sure that I was not running, or had not run, in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even Titus, who was with me, was not compelled to be circumcised, though he was a Greek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But because of false brothers and sisters secretly brought in, who slipped in to spy on the freedom we have in Christ Jesus, so that they might enslave us—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: we did not submit to them even for a moment, so that the truth of the gospel might always remain with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from those who were supposed to be acknowledged leaders (what they actually were makes no difference to me; God shows no partiality)—those leaders contributed nothing to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the contrary, when they saw that I had been entrusted with the gospel for the uncircumcised, just as Peter had been entrusted with the gospel for the circumcised
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (for he who worked through Peter making him an apostle to the circumcised also worked through me in sending me to the gentiles),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when James and Cephas and John, who were acknowledged pillars, recognized the grace that had been given to me, they gave to Barnabas and me the right hand of fellowship, agreeing that we should go to the gentiles and they to the circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked only one thing, that we remember the poor, which was actually what I was eager to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Cephas came to Antioch, I opposed him to his face because he stood self-condemned,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for until certain people came from James, he used to eat with the gentiles. But after they came, he drew back and kept himself separate for fear of the circumcision faction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the other Jews joined him in this hypocrisy, so that even Barnabas was led astray by their hypocrisy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when I saw that they were not acting consistently with the truth of the gospel, I said to Cephas before them all, “If you, though a Jew, live like a gentile and not like a Jew, how can you compel the gentiles to live like Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We ourselves are Jews by birth and not gentile sinners,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet we know that a person is justified not by the works of the law but through the faith of Jesus Christ. And we have come to believe in Christ Jesus, so that we might be justified by the faith of Christ and not by doing the works of the law, because no one will be justified by the works of the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if, in our effort to be justified in Christ, we ourselves have been found to be sinners, is Christ then a servant of sin? Certainly not!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I build up again the very things that I once tore down, then I demonstrate that I am a transgressor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For through the law I died to the law, so that I might live to God. I have been crucified with Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it is no longer I who live, but it is Christ who lives in me. And the life I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not nullify the grace of God, for if righteousness comes through the law, then Christ died for nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You foolish Galatians! Who has bewitched you? It was before your eyes that Jesus Christ was publicly exhibited as crucified!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The only thing I want to learn from you is this: Did you receive the Spirit by doing the works of the law or by believing what you heard?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are you so foolish? Having started with the Spirit, are you now ending with the flesh?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did you experience so much for nothing?—if it really was for nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Well then, does God supply you with the Spirit and work miracles among you by your doing the works of the law or by your believing what you heard?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as Abraham “believed God, and it was reckoned to him as righteousness,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so, you see, those who believe are the descendants of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the scripture, foreseeing that God would reckon as righteous the gentiles by faith, declared the gospel beforehand to Abraham, saying, “All the gentiles shall be blessed in you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason, those who believe are blessed with Abraham who believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all who rely on the works of the law are under a curse, for it is written, “Cursed is everyone who does not observe and obey all the things written in the book of the law.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it is evident that no one is reckoned as righteous before God by the law, for “the one who is righteous will live by faith.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the law does not rest on faith; on the contrary, “Whoever does the works of the law will live by them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Christ redeemed us from the curse of the law by becoming a curse for us—for it is written, “Cursed is everyone who hangs on a tree”—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order that in Christ Jesus the blessing of Abraham might come to the gentiles, so that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers and sisters, I give an example from daily life: once a person’s will has been ratified, no one adds to it or annuls it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the promises were made to Abraham and to his offspring; it does not say, “And to offsprings,” as of many, but it says, “And to your offspring,” that is, to one person, who is Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My point is this: the law, which came four hundred thirty years later, does not annul a covenant previously ratified by God, so as to nullify the promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the inheritance comes from the law, it no longer comes from the promise, but God granted it to Abraham through the promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why then the law? It was added because of transgressions, until the offspring would come to whom the promise had been made, and it was ordained through angels by a mediator.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a mediator involves more than one party, but God is one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is the law then opposed to the promises of God? Certainly not! For if a law had been given that could make alive, then righteousness would indeed come through the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the scripture has imprisoned all things under the power of sin, so that what was promised through the faith of Jesus Christ might be given to those who believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now before faith came, we were imprisoned and guarded under the law until faith would be revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the law was our disciplinarian until Christ came, so that we might be reckoned as righteous by faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now that faith has come, we are no longer subject to a disciplinarian,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for in Christ Jesus you are all children of God through faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As many of you as were baptized into Christ have clothed yourselves with Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no longer Jew or Greek; there is no longer slave or free; there is no longer male and female, for all of you are one in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you belong to Christ, then you are Abraham’s offspring, heirs according to the promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My point is this: heirs, as long as they are minors, are no better than those who are enslaved, though they are the owners of all the property,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they remain under guardians and trustees until the date set by the father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So with us; while we were minors, we were enslaved to the elemental principles of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the fullness of time had come, God sent his Son, born of a woman, born under the law,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order to redeem those who were under the law, so that we might receive adoption as children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because you are children, God has sent the Spirit of his Son into our hearts, crying, “Abba! Father!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you are no longer a slave but a child, and if a child then also an heir through God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Formerly, when you did not know God, you were enslaved to beings that by nature are not gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, however, that you have come to know God, or rather to be known by God, how can you turn back again to the weak and beggarly elemental principles? How can you want to be enslaved to them again?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are observing special days and months and seasons and years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am afraid that my work for you may have been wasted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers and sisters, I beg you: become as I am, for I also have become as you are. You have done me no wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know that it was because of a physical infirmity that I first announced the gospel to you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: though my condition put you to the test, you did not scorn or despise me but welcomed me as an angel of God, as Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What has become of the goodwill you felt? For I testify that, had it been possible, you would have torn out your eyes and given them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have I now become your enemy by telling you the truth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They make much of you but for no good purpose; they want to exclude you, so that you may make much of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is good to be made much of for a good purpose at all times and not only when I am present with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My little children, for whom I am again in the pain of childbirth until Christ is formed in you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wish I were present with you now and could change my tone, for I am perplexed about you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell me, you who desire to be subject to the law, will you not listen to the law?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is written that Abraham had two sons, one by an enslaved woman and the other by a free woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One, the child of the enslaved woman, was born according to the flesh; the other, the child of the free woman, was born through the promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this is an allegory: these women are two covenants. One woman, in fact, is Hagar, from Mount Sinai, bearing children for slavery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Hagar is Mount Sinai in Arabia and corresponds to the present Jerusalem, for she is in slavery with her children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the other woman corresponds to the Jerusalem above; she is free, and she is our mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it is written,
“Rejoice, you childless one, you who bear no children,
    burst into song and shout, you who endure no birth pangs,
for the children of the desolate woman are more numerous
    than the children of the one who is married.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you, my brothers and sisters, are children of the promise, like Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But just as at that time the child who was born according to the flesh persecuted the child who was born according to the Spirit, so it is now also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what does the scripture say? “Drive out the enslaved woman and her child, for the child of the enslaved woman will not share the inheritance with the child of the free woman.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, brothers and sisters, we are children, not of an enslaved woman but of the free woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For freedom Christ has set us free. Stand firm, therefore, and do not submit again to a yoke of slavery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen! I, Paul, am telling you that, if you let yourselves be circumcised, Christ will be of no benefit to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once again I testify to every man who lets himself be circumcised that he is obliged to obey the entire law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You who want to be reckoned as righteous by the law have cut yourselves off from Christ; you have fallen away from grace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For through the Spirit, by faith, we eagerly wait for the hope of righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision counts for anything; the only thing that counts is faith working through love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You were running well; who prevented you from obeying the truth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Such persuasion does not come from the one who calls you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A little yeast leavens the whole batch of dough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am confident about you in the Lord that you will not think otherwise. But whoever it is that is confusing you will pay the penalty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But my brothers and sisters, why am I still being persecuted if I am still preaching circumcision? In that case the offense of the cross has been removed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wish those who unsettle you would castrate themselves!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you were called to freedom, brothers and sisters, only do not use your freedom as an opportunity for self-indulgence, but through love become enslaved to one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the whole law is summed up in a single commandment, “You shall love your neighbor as yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If, however, you bite and devour one another, take care that you are not consumed by one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Live by the Spirit, I say, and do not gratify the desires of the flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what the flesh desires is opposed to the Spirit, and what the Spirit desires is opposed to the flesh, for these are opposed to each other, to prevent you from doing what you want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you are led by the Spirit, you are not subject to the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the works of the flesh are obvious: sexual immorality, impurity, debauchery,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: idolatry, sorcery, enmities, strife, jealousy, anger, quarrels, dissensions, factions,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: envy, drunkenness, carousing, and things like these. I am warning you, as I warned you before: those who do such things will not inherit the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By contrast, the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, generosity, faithfulness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: gentleness, and self-control. There is no law against such things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who belong to Christ have crucified the flesh with its passions and desires.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we live by the Spirit, let us also be guided by the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us not become conceited, competing against one another, envying one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My brothers and sisters, if anyone is detected in a transgression, you who have received the Spirit should restore such a one in a spirit of gentleness. Take care that you yourselves are not tempted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bear one another’s burdens, and in this way you will fulfill the law of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if those who are nothing think they are something, they deceive themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All must test their own work; then that work, rather than their neighbor’s work, will become a cause for pride.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all must carry their own loads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who are taught the word must share in all good things with their teacher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be deceived; God is not mocked, for you reap whatever you sow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you sow to your own flesh, you will reap corruption from the flesh, but if you sow to the Spirit, you will reap eternal life from the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So let us not grow weary in doing what is right, for we will reap at harvest time, if we do not give up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, whenever we have an opportunity, let us work for the good of all and especially for those of the family of faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See what large letters I make when I am writing in my own hand!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is those who want to make a good showing in the flesh who try to compel you to be circumcised—only that they may not be persecuted for the cross of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even the circumcised do not themselves obey the law, but they want you to be circumcised so that they may boast about your flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May I never boast of anything except the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, by which the world has been crucified to me and I to the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For neither circumcision nor uncircumcision is anything, but a new creation is everything!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for those who will follow this rule—peace be upon them, and mercy, and upon the Israel of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From now on, let no one make trouble for me, for I carry the marks of Jesus branded on my body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit, brothers and sisters. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
